For a smart enough guy, studying concentration of measure only requires the knowledge of two results. The first result is Markov’s inequality. Let $X$ be a non-negative random variable. Markov’s inequality says that for any $t > 0$, we have $\mathsf{P} \left( X \geq t \right) \leq t^{-1} \mathsf{E}\, X$. The other result is the union bound.
